Hardman & Co - Tax Enhanced Markets
Paul Mattick - Mercia Fund Management
description:
Dr Paul Mattick heads the Investor Relations team, overseeing the management of the funds within Mercia Fund Management, and ensuring investors are supported through timely communication and effective maintenance of the portal.
 
Paul has a wealth of experience in investor relations, having formerly worked as Private Client Manager at Oxford Capital, where he managed more than 250 client relations and took an active involvement in the marketing initiatives of the company, ensuring that investors were kept fully up-to-date with the latest company and industry news.
 
Additionally, Paul is an entrepreneur and business-builder, having been the Founder and Sales Director of a small, profitable importation company.

title: Russell Fryer - Conclusion & Questions
description:
Russell Fryer joined the Mercia Fund Management team in February of 2017 as the Business Development Manager. He helps to develop EIS business from wealth managers and advisers. Previously, he was the Client Services Director.

Russell concludes the event and answers any remaining questions that the guests might have.

title: Hardman & Co - Due Diligence, MiFID II and the FCA
description:
Founded over 20 years ago, Hardman & Co is an FCA registered capital markets research and consultancy business providing a wide range of services to the UK corporate sector. Recently, Hardman has gained significant momentum by addressing challenges that will arise from the imminent introduction of the Markets in Financial Instruments Directive II (MiFID II) in January 2018.

Representing Hardman & Co are Richard Angus and Vilma Pabilionyte. 

Richard is the Head of Business Development at Hardman. He has over 30 years of City experience. His primary area of focus has been US equity capital markets and he has been predominantly involved with the development of growth companies. 

Vilma Pabilionyte is a Business Development Associate at Hardman. Prior to this, Vilma worked as an Executive Assistant and Office Manager at Devonshire Partners, a bespoke executive search firm specialising in asset management.

title: Mark Brownridge - Using Independent Reviews in Your Due Diligence Process
description:
Mark Brownridge is the Director General of EISA, the official trade body for the Enterprise Investment Scheme. Mark has over twenty years experience in Financial services. Previously, he worked for companies such as Tax Efficient Procurement Services and Mazars Financial Planning.

At this event, Mark introduces the use of independent reviews in a company's due diligence process.

title: Are You Ready for MiFID II? (Full Video)
description:
With MiFID II coming into play on the 3rd January 2018, this will have a major impact on our industry. Alternative investments are becoming more mainstream, as the reduction in pension cap and need for portfolio diversification strengthens this area.

Of particular note is how advisers carry out due diligence on behalf of their clients. To help in this crucial area, this CPD-qualifying seminar was organized to help advisors understand the background of these regulatory changes and how to ensure that they have an effective due diligence process in place.

We were joined by Mark Brownridge, Director General of the EIS Association, who provided an overview of the impact of MiFID II on EIS investment, as well as the recent FCA report into anti-competitive risks and use of independent reviews. We were also partnered with Paul Mattick and Russell Fryer from Mercia Tech in creating this event.

title: Russell Fryer - Introduction
description:
Russell Fryer joined the Mercia Fund Management team in February of 2017 as the Business Development Manager. He helps to develop EIS business from wealth managers and advisers. Previously, he was the Client Services Director.

At the Hardman & Co and Mercia Fund  Management event on MiFID II, Russell introduces the event and informs guests on what to expect for the rest of the hour.
